div.p: From Ernst Betche to Joseph Maiden
RB MSS Mnumber, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

To proof.
MS found with a specimen of Brachyscome decipiens (MEL number). Found by P. Short 1992 – see back of p/c for comments about the specimen.
Paddington,
Sydney. 8. April 1899.
He writes this as if M is still alive, but the date looks like 1899 and a comment on the specimen refers to 1898. See M94-04-08.

I had your Brachycomes all this time in my office, but happened to be so busy with other things that I could not find the time to compare them with our Herbarium. Yesterday I took them home and examined them this morning, but with very little results. It seems to me the most perplexing genus of the whole Flora, and none of the Keys published is satisfactory; all the characters run into each other, neither the wings of the achenes nor the radical- or stem-leaves are constant. I wish Baron v. Mueller would publish a monography of the genus, but, I believe, even he, with his great experience and enormous herbarium-material would find great difficulties in setting the boundaries of the species. The whole genus seems to be in an unsettled state, that is, in a state of very active variation. Only 5 of all the N. S. Wales Brachycomes are figured; could not Mr Baker use his skill in drawing to figure any of the Brachycomes from which you have quite complete material? that would be a first step to the difficult monography of the genus.
Much obliged for the copy of the description of Aster Belli. The Hydrocotyle Mr. Baker gave me, when I called last week, seems to me a peculiar form of H. Candollei .
